text: Been getting the run around with collision shops in Florida after I was involved in a hit and run accident during 4th of July weekend. When I called BMW of MCC, the worker I talked to initially told me October but after emailing him the estimate from my insurance company, he said that they could fit me in their schedule for August. I am very impressed with how accommodating this shop seems to be!!

name: Jeff N
text: I was calling around to see if it was possible for a shop to estimate my vehicle and take it in the same week. Most shops I called told me that it'll take about a week for them to get a chance to look at the car. I spoke with Danny and he said that I can look at the car anytime but taking it in depends on how severe the damages are. I brought the vehicle in and right away, he told me that he'll take it in because if water got on the car, it'll damage the electrical components. After a few minutes of taking down my info and he called Hertz for me to see if they can pick me up to get my rental. After 10 minutes of trying, he said "You know what? I'll just take you up there". He even waited till I signed the documents to my rental. The level of service he's provided me made me feel like I chosen the right place to take my vehicle to. The quality of work to the service, top notch! I definitely would recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Jeff for your kind words! We are so glad we were able to provide you with a great experience and exceed your expectations! We'll be happy to pass your positive feedback to Danny. Please let us know if there is anything else we can help you with. We look forward to your next visit!

text: So far, not so good. BMW Collision received my daughter's car early afternoon on January 1/19/21. Damage to the car was minor--a detached front bumper/grill. They also told the insurance company that they had the bumper, brackets, and splash shield in stock and that the repair would be a 2-3 day job. When I reached out to BMW Collision on the 3rd day (1/28/21), they said there was "a parts delay" and that it would be "first of next week." Turning a 2-3 day job into at least six! What?

name: Josh Matthews
text:
They have no idea how to work with an insurance company. They screwed it up and 3 days after the car is done they are still trying to fix things with insurance. After 3 days I called and specifically asked what the full amount needed to release the car was and was told in no uncertain terms to bring $2k and they would release it. When I got there they changed their minds and wanted $4k. Drove 3 hours to pick it up only to have to leave without it. Typical bmw.

To be clear this was no miscommunication. Before I left my house I asked specifically “what amount of money do I need to bring with me for the car to be released” and was told $2k in response to that question. Now they want to act like that is just what insurance still owes them for a supplement on top of my deductibles, after 3 hours previously telling me they would release the car for a flat $2k payment. A lie.

resp.text:
Thank you for speaking with me about this and allowing me to address this. We truly appreciate your business and we’re deeply sorry for this miscommunication. If there is ever anything I can assist you with, please feel free to contact me.

Craig Rowley
Collision Manager
crowley@Group1Auto.com

text:
I bought a used Tundra that had been worked out of for 8 years. It showed. The paint was scratched, worn looking, and dull. The interior was completely covered in a film of dirt. The leather was worn and hard. The engine was covered in dirt and sticks. This truck had probably never been cleaned.
I brought it to Auto Shine after looking around Auburn for places to get it detailed, comparing prices, services, etc. In my opinion there is no other place anyone should get a vehicle detailed.
Chris completely restored the paint, got a majority of the scratches out, and it shines as if it were a brand new truck. The work he did to bring the exterior back to life was incredible. The interior looks spotless, the leather refurbished and soft. Everything about the truck looked great. I didn't know it was possible to make an old vehicle look this new again! Chris is very passionate about his work, pays great attention to detail, and all at a very reasonable price. I will be bringing my truck back up there to get the headlights restored soon.

When I went back to get my vehicle (three weeks later - yeah, it really got messed up), it looked and drove like nothing had ever happened! Paint was a perfect match, every detail was attended to! WELL DONE, TONY!

Nothing personal, but I naturally hope I don't get in another collision in northeast Alabama... but if I do, trust me: I know exactly where my vehicle is going for repairs and restoration.

name: Dan
text: I had a car with damage to the front seat and attempted to get an estimate.  Called several times a week for about two weeks with no answer.  The wife finally decided to drive down to the shop to see if we could get find some info in person.  She ended up waiting around for quite a while before someone finally got to her, and the staff seemed rather annoyed that they had to take time out to talk to a customer.  They finally sent someone to look at the car, took some pictures, and told her they would get back to us in a couple days with an estimate.  He was pleasant and professional. That was 24 May. A couple weeks went by and nothing... tried calling multiple times and got no answer.  When someone finally answered, she was extremely unprofessional and quite rude.  We told her our situation, and asked the status of our estimate; she said the one who helped us was new, and that there was no way they were going to get back to us that fast, said it was going to be a while, but couldn't give us any sort of expected response time.  She was snappy, extremely rude, and pretty unprofessional.  19 June and still no response... pretty sure we're headed to Norm's out in Gurley.

name: D. Williams
text:
Kenny had my car for over four years and he handed it to me unfinished. My radiator had no fluid in it and was rusty. It is currently being flushed. Tools that were used were left under the radiator. Yep still on the car! The water reservoir was also empty and rusty. He didn’t put a thermostat in and the housing was also rusted. The spark plugs were stripped. The distributor wasn’t tightened. The motor mounts weren’t bolted down. Ball joints weren’t greased. Brand new vintage lines were broken and creased. He put the wrong serpentine belt on. Wilwood breaks were not properly installed. This is just the tip of the iceberg. After spending well over $60k this is certainly not the quality work I was anticipating. Now my car is back in the shop...smh.

P.S. The paint is GARBAGE!!! I have pictures/receipts for all of these claims.

name: Cameron Grace
text: I had windows tinted on May 29.  First indication I should have left was when the price in person increased from the phone price. I went ahead anyway.  They ran my vehicle the entire time while working (1 1/2 hrs) even after my request not to do so. Their explanation was the battery would discharge otherwise.  I have had numerous vehicles tinted and have never incurred this problem.  Upon inspection, many ares of small bubbles were noted.  They insisted they were water bubbles and said they would go away. I returned on June 4 to address the bubbles that remained.  The employee still insisted they were air bubbles and to give a few more days.  I returned on June 13 (my next opportunity).  The man in charge asked for my receipt and said that I was past my warranty for replacement and there was nothing he would do.  I would not recommend this shop simply because they do not stand behind their work.  I had returned (June 4) within the warranty time frame (14 days) and they sent me away insisting the problem would go away.  The problem remains.  All they want is your money, not your business.  I wish I would have received the same service the other review received.  Go elsewhere!

name: Henry Seright
text: This was the worst experience I have ever had at any automotive accessory shop. On 3 July I took my GS350 to have the tint removed from my rear glass and have it replaced with ceramic tint that I purchased from tintzoom online for $200.00. When I arrived the owner and I agreed on a price of $190.00 to do all window with the exception of the left front and left rear (I had already installed it) with the tint I supplied. Having done over 50 tint jobs at a reputable local shop while in college (10 years ago) I know the proper way of installing tint, but being a little rusty I decided to take it to a professional to ensure the tint was removed properly (Steamer or Ammonia and Black Bag). After pulling the car into the shop to start the job I noticed the CARWASH DETAILER with a razor blade hacking at the tint in the rear window. I immediately asked him to stop and asked the owner to take over before he ruin the rear glass defroster. I then left with my ride that was waiting (big mistake) and had him take me to the bank to get cash for the job.  When I returned my car was supposedly ready. I looked at my rear package and it was covered with tint scrapings and my defrost lines were no longer black they were gold (as in no longer working from scraping with a razor). I also noticed that my 3rd brake light was torn to pieces, and there were several pieces of tint left on the window with new film laid on top of it. Soon after I spoke with the manager to inform him of my displeasure with the services rendered. The first thing I asked the owner about was my 3rd brake light and his answer was “We had to break it to put the film on.” The second was my defroster his response was” We had to get the tint off.” The third issue with this humbling experience was the patches of old tint eft on the window with new tint installed over it, in which I received no response from the owner. My response to the owner was “I am not paying for this,” so he decided to vacuum some of the tint from the rear package tray and reduce the price to $165.00 since he broke my $250.00 3rd brake light. After I still refused to pay we both called the police (Little did he know I was on the phone with a good friend who is deputy chief of police). So between the times the police arrived he decided to rip the tint off the windows and throw my $200.00 ceramic tint in the trash, despite his wife warning him not to. When the police arrived he lied about ripping the tint off and even said I didn’t bring any tint to him and stated that he supplied the tint. After looking at the car the officer asked why is there just tint on the driver side windows, I stated that is because those were the windows I did myself. To end the story the officers did nothing (OF COURSE) and stated it was a civil matter which is probably true. Long story short I am out $568.49 to replace the rear glass to get my defrosters back (plus installation), $200.00 for the ceramic tint that he decided to rip from the window and throw in the trash, and $250.00 for my 3rd brake light the he tore up. PLEASE do not go to the poor established called Customized Auto Detail & Window Tinting or you will receive a humbling experience like mine.

text: I usually don’t leave reviews but was too impressed! I have a 2020 Ram 1500. I had some surface scratches/scuffs from rubbing up against some dry brittle yet hard bushes. I called around a few places for quotes and without getting into pricing I’ll just say these guys did it for close to half of my best quoted price. Was also told (from other places) it would take a matter of days and did not have any weekend availability till March. I use my truck for work so this was not possible. Quality Car Care came highly recommended by a friend of mine who runs a collision center. I called on Friday and was told to drop the car off on Sunday. I dropped it off at 8am and was called to pick it up at 2pm. The work was stellar. They even got off some tree sap that 2 other car wash places was unable to remove. Again I never leave reviews but these guys are the real deal and people need to know about places like this especially at such a trying time for small businesses. Truly one of the few (if not only) places that actually deliver a great product for a bargain price. I will never take my vehicle anywhere else.

Another car had a strange symptom; they correctly diagnosed two cascading failures up the line and fixed everything. If a repair isn't going to be cost effective, they'll tell you that too. I would like to thank technician 'Jim' in particular in showing great integrity, reaching out to me when he knew the issue was not correctly repaired. text: Russell Brothers Auto is the best repair shop in this city hands down.  I have been having my vehicles serviced there for over ten years. They work on any make and model of vehicle and can perform any type of maintenance from fluid changes, up to engine replacement.  The staff is friendly and the service top notch.  They have always had my vehicles ready the same day I drop them off.  The value cannot be beat.  They do not suggest needless services just to pad an invoice, if your car is not running or something electrical doesn't work, they will immediately get to the heart of the problem and take care of it.  They stand by their work and I will wholeheartedly recommend to anyone if you need your car repaired take it to Russell Brothers, you won't be disappointed.

The guy that was crabbing about his experience...., If you say "Fix it!" they will fix it. If you say tell me what is wrong and how much, then they will do that as well. BTW, it cost $$ to diagnose and this is sometimes the most expensive part of a repair. Communication is key and it goes both ways.

These guys are about the only honest ones left. They are so good that many dealers around town bring their used cars to them because their own mechanics can neither fix nor diagnose what is wrong with them. Or maybe they just don't want to get their hands dirty!
Jim and his guys will get greasy and keep you on the road!
